exercises.Key Details: Lie on the floor or use a stable chair as a substitute for a bench.
Hold a dumbbell or kettlebell with both hands at chest level while performing squats.
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, swing the kettlebell between your legs, and thrust your hips forward to swing it to chest height.
Sit on the edge of a chair, grip the front edge, and lower yourself down by bending your elbows.
Place the barbell on the floor, bend at the hips and knees to grip it, and stand up by extending your hips and knees.
Hold dumbbells in both hands, step forward with one leg, and lower your body until your front knee is at a 90-degree angle.
Lie on the floor, hold a kettlebell straight above you, and proceed to stand up while keeping your arm extended.
Step up onto the chair with one foot, pushing through your heel, and then step down. Repeat with the other foot.
Hold the barbell at shoulder level and press it straight up above your head.
Hold dumbbells at your sides with palms facing forward and curl them upward, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Get into a push-up position with each hand gripping a kettlebell, row one kettlebell up towards your chest while balancing on the other hand.
Sit on the edge of the chair, lean back slightly, and raise your legs, bringing your knees towards your chest.
Hold the barbell across your collarbone in front of your body and perform squats.
Hold dumbbells at shoulder level and press them overhead, rotating your palms as you lift.
Hold the kettlebell against your chest with both hands and perform lunges.
Place your hands on the edge of the chair, extend your legs behind you, and lower your chest towards the chair, then push back up.
Bend forward with a flat back, hold the barbell with an overhand grip, and pull it towards your lower abdomen.
Hold dumbbells in front of your thighs, hinge at the hips with a slight knee bend, and lower the weights towards the ground while keeping your back straight.
Sit on the floor, lean back slightly, hold a kettlebell with both hands, and twist your torso from side to side.
Perform chair step-ups but at the top of the movement, bring your opposite knee towards your chest.
Hold the barbell with an underhand grip, arms fully extended, and curl the weight up towards your chest.
Hold dumbbells at your sides, raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the floor, then lower them back down.
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, pass the kettlebell around your legs in a figure 8 motion, switching hand positions.
Assume a push-up position with your hands on the chair and alternate driving your knees towards your chest.
Hold the barbell across your upper back, step forward with one leg, and lower your body until your front knee is at a 90-degree angle.
Bend forward at the hips, hold dumbbells with arms bent, and extend your arms behind you, squeezing your triceps.
Swing the kettlebell between your legs, clean it to shoulder height, and press it overhead.
Sit on the edge of the chair, extend your legs forward, and then bring them back towards your chest.
Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, hinge at the hips with a slight knee bend, and lower the barbell towards the ground while keeping your back straight.
Bend forward with a flat back, hold dumbbells with an overhand grip, and pull them towards your lower abdomen.
Hold the kettlebell overhead with one hand, hinge at the hips, and lower your opposite hand down towards the ground while keeping your legs straight.
Sit on the edge of the chair, hold dumbbells at shoulder level, and press them overhead.
Hold the barbell overhead with arms fully extended, squat down while keeping the barbell steady.
Hold dumbbells at your sides with palms facing inward, curl them upward while keeping your elbows close to your body.
Hold a kettlebell in one hand, hinge forward at the hips while lifting one leg behind you, and lower the kettlebell towards the ground.
Assume a push-up position with your hands on the chair and hold the position, keeping your body straight.
Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, pull it up towards your chin, keeping it close to your body.
Hold dumbbells at your sides, step backward with one leg, and lower your body until your back knee is almost touching the ground.
Hold the kettlebell by the horns with both hands, circle it around your head, and repeat in the opposite direction.
Sit on the edge of the chair, lean to one side, and raise your leg out to the side, then repeat on the other side.
Lie on the floor or use a stable chair as a substitute for a bench, hold the barbell above your chest, and press it upwards.
Hold dumbbells at your sides, raise them straight in front of you until they are at shoulder level, then lower them back down.
Hold a kettlebell at chest level, perform a squat, and as you rise, press the kettlebell overhead.
Sit on the edge of the chair, lean back slightly, hold your hands together, and twist your torso from side to side.
Bend forward with a flat back, hold the barbell with an overhand grip, and raise it out to the sides while squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Hold dumbbells at your sides, place one foot behind you on a chair or sturdy surface, and perform squats with the other leg.
Hold a kettlebell by your side with one hand, hinge at the hips with a slight knee bend, and lift the kettlebell off the ground.
Stand on the edge of the chair, raise your heels as high as possible, and then lower them back down.
